alert.note: Alert for Baldwin (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 26 at 9:34PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Alabama and northwest Florida, including the following counties, in Alabama, Baldwin and Escambia. In northwest Florida, Escambia and Santa Rosa. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 933 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Areas around Century and Jay Florida up along US Highway 31 towards Brewton Alabama will be the most likely areas for flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Atmore, Brewton, Century, Flomaton, East Brewton, Molino, Jay, Pollard, Riverview, Bratt, I65 And AL 21, I65 And CR 1, South Flomaton, Wahl, Welka, Bluff Springs, Byrneville, Osaka, Brownsdale and Wawbeek.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
